name: Dreams Beach Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 2nd holiday to Egypt this year and was pleased with the hotel. We have not stayed at the Dreams Beach before, have been to Sharm 6 times and will be returning to this hotel. Hotel staff were second to none, they could not do enough for us. Rooms were spacious and were very clean. We had a ground floor sea view which was lovely especially when you looked out in the morning. My only moan was that there were no tea/coffe making facilities in the room although when we asked they told us that they were only provided for the first night of your stay but they still had some sent to our room.
reviews.title: great break in the sun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated right near the sea, the beach is spread onto different levels which we liked as it meant you are not squashed in like sardines but you can't really paddle in the sea unless you walk along the sunken jetty. Snorkling is good though as you are right on the coral as soon as you get in and there are also a couple of life guards sat in towers watching for sharks .
reviews.title: Great Location especially for Divers

reviews.text: The pools are good although the large Dreams Beach pool was full of children. If you want it quiet you can get the little Taf Taf to next door at Dreams vacation and this is apparently really quiet and looks bigger. Walking is about 10 mins.
reviews.title: Great service, weather and value.

reviews.text: Food is excellent in the main buffet restaurant and we tried the italian which was good and AI. Also the grill a la carte but didn't enjoy this as much. We went to the Asia restaurant and it only cost us £24 for the meals and all our drinks and the food and atmosphere was lovely. The grill opens at lunch for snacks but the menu is the same each day which could do with more variety.
reviews.title: WOW in 5 yrs its only got better its paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a turkish bath and thoroughly enjoyed this. If you are planning to do this it needs to be on your first day so you tan better and also if you are slightly pink from the sun it can be tender when they exfoliate! Book this with the lads who hassle you as you sunbathe and make sure you haggle with them. We booked with Amwar who is really funny. They are all pleasant and its good to banter wuth them but some people find them annoying as they do keep coming round. If you really don't want it ask for an orange sign that you put up nearby so that they know not to hassle you.
reviews.title: Nice relaxing Holiday

reviews.text: We travelled here for a week as a party of four women for a friends birthday on AI board basis.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort - shame about the A1 drinks though.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cost of holiday package was 540 GBP.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, so many facilities, friendly staff and great service

reviews.text: Accommodation - hotel is definitely not a 5* , but is at best 4*. However at the price we paid it represented very good value for money,
reviews.title: Great Resort

reviews.text: Location - The hotel is a few miles from from Naama Bay, in Sharm El Sheikh. This was easily reached by taxi from outside the hotel at a cost of 2 Egyptian Pounds each way or a free hotel bus between 21:00 and 00:01hrs. Which you could book in reception. Naama Bay is very busy with many bars and restaurants. There are hoards of street sellers continually trying to get you into their shops/bars etc but a friendly 'no thank's' suffices, and they are quite happy to chat and have a laugh with you. We visited the Camel Bar and Hard Rock for a change of an evening, both were good fun with entertaining bar staff.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, average food, poor alcohol, pushy sales staff!

reviews.text: There is a row of shops close to the hotel which was quieter and cheaper. We also got a taxi to the market which is an experience!! Everyone wanted to sell us their wares, became a bit of a hassle so we only spent about 40 minutes there and jumped a cab back to the hotel
reviews.title: Very enjoyable rest!
More of a 3* - bit shabby but exceptionally clean - Overall good.
reviews.text: This hotel shouldnt really be classed as a Thompson 4* (although thats more the travel operators fault than the the hotels) The staff are friendly and nice but it looks like it could do with a good refurb as the smaller details make it look a little shabby. Our room was nice and cleanede impeccably each day, though the bathroom again was a bit shabby and needed an upodate. Tip the cleaner, you do get more drinks and its not like you have to give much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If youre going out of season bear in mind only two or three of the seven restaurants will be open. Saying that - though the food was sometimes a bit weird in the main restaurant neither my partner or I ever had stomach problems which we heard residents of a lot of other hotels complain about.
reviews.title: Two for the price of one.....

reviews.text: Staff were helpful and friendly - with the exception of the reception staff who has everybody has rightly pointed out - were bordering on rude.
reviews.title: Good Value and loads to do

reviews.text: Definately try and go onn trips - the quad biking and camel riding is mazing nd great value for money.
reviews.title: This is not a 4 star hotel I have stayed in better 3 star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, if you're yet to book this hotel maybe look around and pay a little bit more for luxury (the renaissnce looked amazing!) - however if you've already booked don't panic, we had a great time and the most important thing really is cleanliness and good food - both of which this hotel definately has!
reviews.title: Book Dreams VACATION

reviews.text: i enjoyed this hotel soo much and i think that the end of march and the beginning of april were the perfect as there were not too many people there but there were enough people for you to be able to feel like you could talk to people.
reviews.title: i loved it- im a travel agemt and this is not bad for thwe price at all

reviews.text: FOOD: a good selection of restaurants and there were different themes for the food . such as an egyptian night and a international night . there was also the grill house , the italiana and the food at the dreams vacation
reviews.title: Pleasant stay at Dreams Beach

reviews.text: FACILITIES: there was a range of pools and the beahc area as well as being able to get the "taf taf" down to the dreams vacation where you were able to use the pools there aswell. it also had the beach area at the dreams beach aswell as shops and bars . the waterfall effect in the lobby was amazing
reviews.title: PARADISE IN THE SUN

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS: ouir hotel room was cleaned everday without fail and there was fresh towels and bedding laid out and a the restaurant the service was amazing. they always took your plate as soon as u had finished.
reviews.title: Really lovely! I would not believe every bad review that you read

reviews.text: all in all i enjoyed the stay abnd i also have to say that joe and jabu from the animation team were amazing and that the perfume shop at the dreams beach was somewhere where you could sit for hours
reviews.title: nice hotel, lovely food!

aka: Dreams Beach Hotel Sharm El Sheikh
